meanings.definition: A mark indicating that something has been noted, verified, or completed.
meanings.sent1: I put a checkmark next to my name on the attendance sheet.
meanings.sent2: She added a checkmark to the list of tasks she completed.
meanings.sent3: The checkmark on the test paper made me smile.
meanings.sent4: His signature was like a checkmark, confirming the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The bright red checkmark stood out on the white paper.

meanings.sent1: Please checkmark the items you have packed in the box.
meanings.sent2: He always checkmarks his to-do list once he finishes a task.
meanings.sent3: I checkmark my calendar to make sure I don't forget important dates.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work checkmarks her as a reliable employee.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked us to checkmark the correct answers on the quiz.

meanings.definition: A symbol in the shape of a V, used to indicate that something is correct or has been done.
meanings.sent1: The online form had a green checkmark next to the completed sections.
meanings.sent2: He drew a checkmark on his paper to show he got the answer right.
meanings.sent3: The checkmark on the cake was a delightful surprise for the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a checkmark of approval for his efforts.
meanings.sent5: The checkmark on the map showed the correct route to take.
